alert.note: Alert for Carlton; St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 7:34PM CDT until August 18 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Minnesota, including the following counties, Carlton and St. Louis. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 PM CDT, Doppler radar estimated between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of one half to one inch are possible over the area the rest of the night. Expect rises on the Moose Horn, Kettle and Tamarack rivers. Some rural roads may be flooded. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moose Lake, Barnum, Mahtowa, Cromwell, Kettle River, Fond Du Lac Band Sawyer Area, Fond Du Lac Band Cloquet Area, Big Lake, Automba, Wright, Prairie Lake, Kettle Lake, Moose Lake State Park and Sawyer. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
